Class UserInterfaceMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserInterfaceMethods

  • public class UserInterfaceMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods that are required to run the system, without creating or editing Person or Project objects.

    The methods in this class consists of repeating or lengthy display options as well as checking if user input is valid or not. The methods do pull information form the Project and Person objects, but do not create or modify it.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterfaceMethods

        public UserInterfaceMethods()

    • Method Detail

      • displayOptions

        public static void displayOptions()
        This method displays the options of the main menu.

        The options include creating a new object, editing an existing project, display projects that still have to be completed, dispay projects that are overdue and to exit the program.

      • getUserChoice

        public static int getUserChoice()
        This method requests the user to input an integer to execute an option from the main menu.

        The method request the user to input an integer form 1-6. After receiving the input, it checks if the input is valid. If not, it requests the user to try again.

        Returns:
        returns the integer for the main menu option chosen
        See Also:
        #displayEditOptions()

      • displayEditOptions

        public static void displayEditOptions()
        This method displays all the project options which can be edited.

        The options include to update the project fee, the total paid to date, the project deadline, the project arhitect's contact details, the project contractor's contact details and the project customer's contact details.

      • generateInvoive

        public static void generateInvoive(int indexToFinalize,
                                   Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        This method displays an invoice to the user when called.

        The method displays the specific project's customer name, customer telephone number, customer email address and customer physical address. It also calculates the amount outstanding on the project by calling the amountOutstandingToBePaid method, and displays this as part of the invoice.

        Parameters:
        indexToFinalize - Index integer of the project within the projects array.
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        See Also:
        #getProjectCustomer(), #getPersonName(), #getTelephoneNumber(), #getPhysicalAddress(), #getEmailAddress()

      • displayProjectsOverdue

        public static int displayProjectsOverdue()
        This method displays all the projects that are overdue.

        This method focuses on getting the project details that are overdue and displaying it in a readable format. The overdue projects are placed in an array by calling the createArrayListForProjectsOverdue method.

        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #readInputAndSaveProjectArray(), #convertStringArrayListToProjectArray(ArrayList), #createArrayListForProjectsOverdue(Project[]), #getProjectNumber(), #getProjectName(), #getProjectDeadline(), #runMainMenu()

      • displayProjectStillToBeCompleted

        public static int displayProjectStillToBeCompleted()
        This method displays all the projects that still have to be completed.

        This method focuses on getting the project details that still have to completed and displaying it in a readable format. The incomplete projects are placed in an array by calling the createIncompleteProjectsArray method.

        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #readInputAndSaveProjectArray(), #convertStringArrayListToProjectArray(ArrayList), #createIncompleteProjectsArray(Project[]), #getProjectNumber(), #getProjectName(), #getProjectDeadline(), #runMainMenu()

      • runMainMenu

        public static int runMainMenu()
        This method displays the main menu and requests the user to input an option.

        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #displayOptions(), #getUserChoice()
